intro: Leptactina formosa, commonly known as the beautiful leathery fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive, leathery fronds. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest undergrowth. Its fronds are elongated and have a unique, intricate venation pattern. The spores are produced on the underside of the fronds, which are released during the humid seasons.
